results.title: A Class for Tommy
results.brief_description: Story of the establishment of an experimental training class for mentally handicapped children. Purposes of the class are to determine if such children will progress more satisfactorily in elementary school if given special training at an early age; whether certain undesirable attitudes and reactions may be prevented by early enrolment in such a program; and to establish desirable behaviour patterns at an early age in order to allow the child a more nearly normal happy life.

results.title: A City called Copenhagen
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Danish Government Film Office and Minerva Films
results.brief_description: An informal portrait of Copenhagen, emphasising the poetry and picturesqueness of everyday life. Among the delightful scenes and pictures are municipal dances in the park, the Tivoli Gardens, the old people’s town, children at the pantomime, fishermen and an artist at the docks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jorgen Roos, Danish Government Film Office and Minerva Films

results.title: A Children's Fable
results.brief_description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.
results.description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.

results.title: A child grows: the first year
results.brief_description: This program focuses on the physiological and psychological landmarks of the first year of life: noting that the order, not the timing is predictable. Using footage of infants to illustrate each point of maturation, areas covered include; motor development; muscle control and strength - from birth; reflex actions - smiling, rolling over, sitting, crawling, walking; hand-eye co-ordination; exploration of world and link to feeding and digestion; sensory development; language and speech development; developmental norms; attachment, separation and anxiety; development of thinking, planning, goal directed actions and; symbolic representations. Informative and useful to both students and parents of newborns.

results.title: A Child's voice
results.creator_credit: Kieran Hickey, Roland Hill and B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland)
results.brief_description: A tale of suspense. Three nights a week, Ainsley Rupert Macreadie writes and broadcasts chilling and intriguing tales of horror to rapt audiences. But his latest cruel narrative becomes a reality when the character of the boy involved refuses to obey the writer’s commands, and Macreadie discovers that he is the victim of the kind of terror which until now he has reserved for others. Starring T.P. McKenna as Ainsley Rupert Macreadie, June Tobin as the child. Written by David Thomson and narrated by Valentine Dyall. (Awards: First Prize Short Fiction Category - Chicago International Film Festival, 1978; Festival Choice - London Film Festival, 1978) Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kieran Hickey, Roland Hill and B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland)

results.title: A Child's Christmas in Wales by Dylan Thomas
results.brief_description: Using still photographs, this film shows life in Wales, illustrating Dylan Thomas’s recorded reading of his reminiscences about Christmas in his home country. Children play tricks on their elders, the adults enjoy the food and drink and even the local fire brigade becomes involved.
results.title_for_label: A Child’s Christmas in Wales by Dylan Thomas

results.title: Group Activities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A group of children is presented with some common household materials with which to create things, as the basis for an art lesson. The teacher’s intent is to stimulate individual thought and effort without attempting to pre-determine their efforts.

results.title: Playground
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
The playground provides an opportunity for the child to develop his motor skills. Children are seen in this environment responding to the challenges of obstacles and play things.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A kindergarten child is observed by a speech clinician who is concerned with how children communication, sound discrimination syntax, and the limits of auditory memory span.
